com.vernalis.knime.mmp

Class Leaf

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.Leaf
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Leaf>

    public class Leaf
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Leaf>
    This class provides a canonicalisation mechanism for single-attachment point SMILES strings, and also record the index of the incoming attachment point
    Author:
    s.roughley <knime@vernalis.com>

    • Constructor Summary

      Leaf(java.lang.String smiles)
      Overloaded constructor.
      Leaf(java.lang.String smiles, boolean removeHs)
      Constructor with optional removal of hydrogen atoms.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Leaf

        public Leaf(java.lang.String smiles)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Overloaded constructor. The SMILES is canonicalised after removal of Hydrogens, and the original attachment point index stored for reference
        Parameters:
        smiles - The SMILES String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no or >1 attachment points are found

      • Leaf

        public Leaf(java.lang.String smiles,
    boolean removeHs)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor with optional removal of hydrogen atoms. The SMILES is canonicalised and the incoming attachment point index stored for reference
        Parameters:
        smiles - The SMILES String
        removeHs - Should hydrogen atoms be removed?
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no or >1 attachment points are found

    • Method Detail

      • getCanonicalSmiles

        public java.lang.String getCanonicalSmiles()
        Returns:
        The Canonical SMILES. NB The attachment point will have been de-indexed, and thus will be [*]

      • getIndexedCanonicalSmiles

        public java.lang.String getIndexedCanonicalSmiles(int idx)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the canonical SMILES representation with the attachment point indexed
        Parameters:
        idx - The index for the attachment point
        Returns:
        The canonical SMILES with the attachment point labelled isotopically with the given index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if idx<0

      • getOriginalIndex

        public int getOriginalIndex()
        Returns:
        The original attachment point index

      • getMorganFingerprint

        public org.RDKit.ExplicitBitVect getMorganFingerprint(int radius,
                                             int numBits,
                                             boolean useChirality,
                                             boolean useBondTypes)
        Method to return the RDKit format (ExplicitBitVect) Morgan fingerprint, rooted at the attachment point
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the fingerprint
        numBits - The number of bits in the fingerprint
        useChirality - Use chirality during fingerprint generation
        useBondTypes - Use bond types during fingerprint generation
        Returns:
        The RDKit binary Morgan Fingerprint. NB It is the caller's responsibility to call #delete() on the returned ExplicitBitVect
        See Also:
        getMorganFingerprintCell(int, int, boolean, boolean)

      • getMorganFingerprintCell

        public org.knime.core.data.DataCell getMorganFingerprintCell(int radius,
                                                    int numBits,
                                                    boolean useChirality,
                                                    boolean useBondTypes)
        Wrapper method for getMorganFingerprint(int, int, boolean, boolean) to return the RDKit Morgan fingerprint, rooted at the attachment point, as a KNIME DenseBitVectorCell
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the fingerprint
        numBits - The number of bits in the fingerprint
        useChirality - Use chirality during fingerprint generation
        useBondTypes - Use bond types during fingerprint generation
        Returns:
        The RDKit binary Morgan Fingerprint as a KNIME DenseBitVector Cell
